1980-1986 The Information Systems Group was created by Time Inc. to plan and oversee use of computer and data processing resources by employees of the company. The collection consists of studies on the creation of a corporate data center and personnel/payroll computer systems, history of the data center, and manuals for the use of computer services offered by the Group. Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Arrangement
The Time Inc. Information Systems Records are arranged in alphabetical order.
Biographical / Historical
Information Systems was created by Time Inc. in 1980 to oversee information management systems, make long-term plans for the use of computer resources, and consult with management about data processing needs. It also offered classes on computer use to Time Inc. employees. The increasing use of digital computer technology had a significant effect on editorial operations. Instead of sending stories to a Wire Room reporters began to be able to file stories directly through a dial-up system. In 1981 the Data Center was moved from the Time-Life building to its own facility in the Meadowlands of New Jersey. In 1984 a personnel/payroll computer system called Personnel Information System and Comptroller's Employee payroll and benefits System (PISCES) was created by the Group.

Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Time Inc. in 2015.
Preferred Citation
The collection should be cited as Time Inc. Information Systems Records, MS-3009 RG 61, New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information
The Time Inc. Information Systems Records were processed by Allen Thomas in 2021. The original folders were retained where present; loose material was foldered. Generic binders were disassembled and not retained, and their contents rehoused. Arrangement was imposed. Allen Thomas created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.
Related Materials
This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.
Additional material on Time Inc. Information Systems can be found in the Time Inc. Subject Files (MS 3009-RG 1).
Scope and Contents
The collections consists of documents studying the need for an Information Systems Center and planning documents for the Personnel Information System and Comptroller's Employee payroll and benefits System (PISCES), planning for the creation of an Information Systems Center, and manuals on how Time Inc. employees can make use of services provided by the Information Systems Group.
